tutorial.speak:
To get to the member portal go to your subdomain dot b1 dot church slash member. The content on this portal is the same as the B1.church mobile app.
Of the items added automatically, there are two that will show up for logged out visitors. The first is just a link to the homepage of your website if it has been added. The second is the option to give.
To enable the website option, you simply need to create a home page with the website builder.
You can get to this by first logging in as a user with admin permissions and clicking the admin link on the left.
Go to "Web Site" and click the plus icon to make a home page. The tutorial on the website admin will guide you through this process.
This will cause the website option to appear in the member portal.
The second item is the option to give. This will show up if you have linked a Stripe account to your church.
This is done from the B1.church Admin application. You can get to it by logging in, clicking your profile photo and selecting Switch App.
Within B1.church Admin, go to settings, click Edit and scroll down to the giving section. All giving is powered by Stripe which is a payment gateway. You will need to create an account at Stripe.com if you don't already have one.
To get this key from Stripe, click Developers in the header, and then API Keys. Create a new Standard key and copy paste the public and secret keys into B1.church Admin.
Once valid keys have been entered, users will be able to make online donations. ChurchApps does not charge any fees at all for this feature, however Stripe does charge credit card processing fees. See their documentation for more information. Discounted rates are available for non-profits.
All donations made through B1.church Admin and B1 are logged and detailed reporting and financial statements are avaialable. See the B1.church Admin documentation for more info.
